sentences.en: Coleman lives in fear of the ultimate disgrace.
sentences.cn: 科尔曼整天担心会颜面尽失。

sentences.en: He is a disgrace to our school.
He was in disgrace after his ungentlemanly behavior.
sentences.cn: 他因为行为不检而为人所不齿.

sentences.en: He will die before he shall disgrace himself.
sentences.cn: 他宁肯死而决不受侮辱.

sentences.en: Her behaviour has brought disgrace on her family.
Her son's disgrace broke her heart.
sentences.cn: 她儿子丢脸的事让她很难过.

sentences.en: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
His conduct brought disgrace upon his family.
sentences.cn: 他的所作所为给他家丢人现眼.

sentences.en: His vice president also had to resign in disgrace.
sentences.cn: 他的副总统也被迫不光彩地辞去职务。

sentences.en: How could you disgrace us all like that?
sentences.cn: 你怎么能这样丢我们大家的脸呢？

sentences.en: Kinkel said the attacks had brought disgrace on Germany.
sentences.cn: 金克尔声称这次袭击使德国蒙羞。

sentences.en: She has brought disgrace upon womankind.
Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
sentences.cn: 事情发生之后，史密斯声名狼藉。

sentences.en: Such an act is a disgrace to humanity.
sentences.cn: 这种行为是人类的耻辱.

sentences.en: The minister was dismissed from his office in disgrace.
sentences.cn: 这位部长受到了免职处分.

sentences.en: There was no disgrace in finishing fourth.
sentences.cn: 得了个第四名没什么丢脸的。

sentences.en: What went on was a scandal. It was a disgrace to Britain.
sentences.cn: 发生的一切是个丑闻，是给英国抹黑。

sentences.en: You will bring disgrace on yourself by doing this.
sentences.cn: 你这样做会给自己带来耻辱.

words.tran_cn: 耻辱；贬谪（disgrace的过去式和过去分词）
耻辱；丢脸的人或事；失宠

trans.tran_cn: 丢脸，耻辱，不光彩，丢脸的人（或事）
trans.tran_en: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
to do something so bad that you make other people feel ashamed
the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of

trans.tran_cn: 使丢脸，使失宠，使受耻辱，贬黜
